segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 Deployment Overview

segment.source: This section provides general information and instructions about how to install and deploy Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.
segment.target: This section provides general information and instructions about how to install and deploy Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: MED-V 2.0 is based on an application model, where the same methods that you use to deploy applications can be used to deploy and manage MED-V.
segment.target: MED-V 2.0 is based on an application model, where the same methods that you use to deploy applications can be used to deploy and manage MED-V.

segment.source: A deployed MED-V solution includes two components: the MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent.
segment.target: A deployed MED-V solution includes two components: the MED-V Host Agent and Guest Agent.

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent is installed on the Windows 7 desktop and the MED-V Guest Agent is installed on Windows XP inside the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent is installed on the Windows 7 desktop and the MED-V Guest Agent is installed on Windows XP inside the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: MED-V also includes a MED-V Workspace Packager that provides the information and tools necessary for creating and configuring MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: MED-V also includes a MED-V Workspace Packager that provides the information and tools necessary for creating and configuring MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: MED-V only supports the installation of the MED-V Workspace Packager, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace for all users.
segment.target: MED-V only supports the installation of the MED-V Workspace Packager, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace for all users.

segment.source: Installing MED-V for the current user only by selecting ALLUSERS=”” causes failures in the installation of the components and in the setup of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Installing MED-V for the current user only by selecting ALLUSERS=”” causes failures in the installation of the components and in the setup of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The MED-V Installation Files
segment.target: The MED-V Installation Files

segment.source: MED-V includes the following installation files, required for running MED-V:
segment.target: MED-V includes the following installation files, required for running MED-V:

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent Installation File
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent Installation File

segment.source: The Host Agent installation file is named MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.
segment.target: The Host Agent installation file is named MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.

segment.source: This file is distributed and installed on each relevant end-user computer as part of your enterprise-wide deployment of MED-V.
segment.target: This file is distributed and installed on each relevant end-user computer as part of your enterprise-wide deployment of MED-V.

segment.source: The MED-V Workspace Packager Installation File
segment.target: The MED-V Workspace Packager Installation File

segment.source: The MED-V Workspace Packager installation file is named MED-VWorkspacePackagerSetup.exe.
segment.target: The MED-V Workspace Packager installation file is named MED-VWorkspacePackagerSetup.exe.

segment.source: Use this file to install the MED-V Workspace Packager on a computer where you have administrator rights and permissions.
segment.target: Use this file to install the MED-V Workspace Packager on a computer where you have administrator rights and permissions.

segment.source: The desktop administrator uses the MED-V Workspace Packager to create and manage MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: The desktop administrator uses the MED-V Workspace Packager to create and manage MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.
segment.target: The MED-V Guest Agent is installed automatically during first time setup.

segment.source: The MED-V Deployment Process
segment.target: The MED-V Deployment Process

segment.source: The following is a high-level overview of the MED-V installation and deployment process:
segment.target: The following is a high-level overview of the MED-V installation and deployment process:

segment.source: Install the MED-V Workspace Packager on the computer where you have administrative credentials and that you will be using to build the MED-V workspace packages.
segment.target: Install the MED-V Workspace Packager on the computer where you have administrative credentials and that you will be using to build the MED-V workspace packages.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Install the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Install the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: Prepare your MED-V image and create your MED-V workspace packages by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: Prepare your MED-V image and create your MED-V workspace packages by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: For more information, see Operations for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information, see Operations for MED-V.

segment.source: Deploy the required MED-V components throughout your enterprise.
segment.target: Deploy the required MED-V components throughout your enterprise.

segment.source: The required components of MED-V are Windows Virtual PC, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The required components of MED-V are Windows Virtual PC, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Installation of the MED-V components requires administrative credentials.
segment.target: Installation of the MED-V components requires administrative credentials.

segment.source: If an end user is installing MED-V, they are prompted to enter administrative credentials.
segment.target: If an end user is installing MED-V, they are prompted to enter administrative credentials.

segment.source: Alternately, administrative credentials can be provided in context if you are installing by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system.
segment.target: Alternately, administrative credentials can be provided in context if you are installing by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system.

segment.source: The MED-V Components
segment.target: The MED-V Components

segment.source: The MED-V components that you deploy throughout your enterprise consist of the following:
segment.target: The MED-V components that you deploy throughout your enterprise consist of the following:

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC

segment.source: MED-V functions inside Windows Virtual PC images for its compatibility solution.
segment.target: MED-V functions inside Windows Virtual PC images for its compatibility solution.

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC and the update for Windows 7 (KB977206) are required.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC and the update for Windows 7 (KB977206) are required.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent Installation File
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent Installation File

segment.source: MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.
segment.target: MED-VHostAgentSetup.exe.

segment.source: The MED-V Workspace Installation Files
segment.target: The MED-V Workspace Installation Files

segment.source: The MED-V workspace installation files are created when you build your MED-V workspace package that consists of the following:
segment.target: The MED-V workspace installation files are created when you build your MED-V workspace package that consists of the following:

segment.source: A setup.exe executable program that executes the MED-V workspace installation
segment.target: A setup.exe executable program that executes the MED-V workspace installation

segment.source: A MED-Vworkspacename.msi installer
segment.target: A MED-Vworkspacename.msi installer

segment.source: A VHDfilename.medv file, which is the compressed virtual hard disk
segment.target: A VHDfilename.medv file, which is the compressed virtual hard disk

segment.source: The files for configuration settings (workspacename.reg and workspacename.ps1)
segment.target: The files for configuration settings (workspacename.reg and workspacename.ps1)

segment.source: To deploy MED-V, copy all the required installation files to the host computer or to a share that can be accessed by the host computer.
segment.target: To deploy MED-V, copy all the required installation files to the host computer or to a share that can be accessed by the host computer.

segment.source: Run the component installation files for Windows Virtual PC, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Run the component installation files for Windows Virtual PC, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Then start the MED-V Host Agent to complete the first time setup of MED-V.
segment.target: Then start the MED-V Host Agent to complete the first time setup of MED-V.

segment.source: You can perform the installation manually.
segment.target: You can perform the installation manually.

segment.source: However, we recommend that you use an electronic software distribution method to automate the deployment of the components.
segment.target: However, we recommend that you use an electronic software distribution method to automate the deployment of the components.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace Through an Electronic Software Distribution System.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace Through an Electronic Software Distribution System.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For information about available command-line arguments to control install options, see Command-Line Options for MED-V Installation Files.
segment.target: For information about available command-line arguments to control install options, see Command-Line Options for MED-V Installation Files.

segment.source: Deployment Steps
segment.target: Deployment Steps

segment.source: When you deploy MED-V throughout your enterprise, there are two main considerations: installation and first time setup.
segment.target: When you deploy MED-V throughout your enterprise, there are two main considerations: installation and first time setup.

segment.source: Installation
segment.target: Installation

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC - During installation, MED-V checks for Windows Virtual PC and its required update for Windows 7 (KB977206).
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC - During installation, MED-V checks for Windows Virtual PC and its required update for Windows 7 (KB977206).

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.

segment.source: You can install these as part of the Windows 7 installations before you install MED-V, or you can install them as part of the MED-V distribution.
segment.target: You can install these as part of the Windows 7 installations before you install MED-V, or you can install them as part of the MED-V distribution.

segment.source: However, MED-V does not include a mechanism for their deployment; they must be deployed by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system or as part of the Windows 7 image.
segment.target: However, MED-V does not include a mechanism for their deployment; they must be deployed by using an electronic software distribution (ESD) system or as part of the Windows 7 image.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When you install the MED-V components by using a batch file, a best practice is to specify that Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC hotfix are installed after the MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V workspace package files.
segment.target: When you install the MED-V components by using a batch file, a best practice is to specify that Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC hotfix are installed after the MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V workspace package files.

segment.source: This means that Windows Update will not cause any interference with the installation process by requiring a restart.
segment.target: This means that Windows Update will not cause any interference with the installation process by requiring a restart.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After you install Windows Virtual PC, the computer must be restarted.
segment.target: After you install Windows Virtual PC, the computer must be restarted.

segment.source: MED-V Host Agent – Install the MED-V Host Agent on the Windows 7 computer where MED-V will be run.
segment.target: MED-V Host Agent – Install the MED-V Host Agent on the Windows 7 computer where MED-V will be run.

segment.source: This must be installed before installing the MED-V workspace and checks to make sure that Windows Virtual PC is installed.
segment.target: This must be installed before installing the MED-V workspace and checks to make sure that Windows Virtual PC is installed.

segment.source: MED-V workspace – You create the files that are required in this installation by using the MED-V Workspace Packager: the setup.exe, .medv, and .msi files.
segment.target: MED-V workspace – You create the files that are required in this installation by using the MED-V Workspace Packager: the setup.exe, .medv, and .msi files.

segment.source: To install the MED-V workspace, run setup.exe; this triggers the other files as required.
segment.target: To install the MED-V workspace, run setup.exe; this triggers the other files as required.

segment.source: The installation places an entry in the registry under the local machine run key to start the MED-V Host Agent, which always runs MED-V when Windows is started.
segment.target: The installation places an entry in the registry under the local machine run key to start the MED-V Host Agent, which always runs MED-V when Windows is started.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The installation of the MED-V workspace can be run interactively by the end user or silently through an electronic software distribution system.
segment.target: The installation of the MED-V workspace can be run interactively by the end user or silently through an electronic software distribution system.

segment.source: Installation of the MED-V workspace requires administrative credentials, so end users must be administrators of their computers to install the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Installation of the MED-V workspace requires administrative credentials, so end users must be administrators of their computers to install the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Alternately, an electronic software distribution system typically runs in the system context and has sufficient permissions.
segment.target: Alternately, an electronic software distribution system typically runs in the system context and has sufficient permissions.

segment.source: Tip
segment.target: Tip

segment.source: Because of problems that can occur when you install MED-V from a network location, we recommend that you copy the MED-V workspace setup files locally and then run setup.exe.
segment.target: Because of problems that can occur when you install MED-V from a network location, we recommend that you copy the MED-V workspace setup files locally and then run setup.exe.

segment.source: First Time Setup
segment.target: First Time Setup

segment.source: After MED-V and its required components are installed, MED-V must be configured.
segment.target: After MED-V and its required components are installed, MED-V must be configured.

segment.source: The configuration of MED-V is known as first time setup.
segment.target: The configuration of MED-V is known as first time setup.

segment.source: By using the MED-V Workspace Packager, you can configure first time setup to run silently or interactively.
segment.target: By using the MED-V Workspace Packager, you can configure first time setup to run silently or interactively.

segment.source: First time setup of MED-V requires end users to enter their password to authenticate to the MED-V workspace, but otherwise can be almost invisible to the user.
segment.target: First time setup of MED-V requires end users to enter their password to authenticate to the MED-V workspace, but otherwise can be almost invisible to the user.

segment.source: Notifications are shown in the notification area, such as when first time setup is complete and applications are ready.
segment.target: Notifications are shown in the notification area, such as when first time setup is complete and applications are ready.

segment.source: The following are the actions that occur during first time setup of MED-V:
segment.target: The following are the actions that occur during first time setup of MED-V:

segment.source: The virtual hard disk must be configured.
segment.target: The virtual hard disk must be configured.

segment.source: Mini-Setup runs and expands the Windows XP image.
segment.target: Mini-Setup runs and expands the Windows XP image.

segment.source: Typically, this occurs in a hidden window, but MED-V can be configured to display during this configuration.
segment.target: Typically, this occurs in a hidden window, but MED-V can be configured to display during this configuration.

segment.source: After Mini-Setup finishes, you can run commands that you must have for additional configuration, such as installing ESD software or other applications, or configuring the image.
segment.target: After Mini-Setup finishes, you can run commands that you must have for additional configuration, such as installing ESD software or other applications, or configuring the image.

segment.source: These can be called in the Sysprep.inf file, but are not required there.
segment.target: These can be called in the Sysprep.inf file, but are not required there.

segment.source: For more information, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.

segment.source: Ftscompletion.exe is run as the last step in configuration.
segment.target: Ftscompletion.exe is run as the last step in configuration.

segment.source: This process completes the MED-V configuration, adds the user to the RDP group to let them access the MED-V workspace, copies logs, signals MED-V that the MED-V workspace is ready, and then restarts the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: This process completes the MED-V configuration, adds the user to the RDP group to let them access the MED-V workspace, copies logs, signals MED-V that the MED-V workspace is ready, and then restarts the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: This process can also add the user as an administrator of the MED-V workspace if this was configured when the MED-V workspace was created.
segment.target: This process can also add the user as an administrator of the MED-V workspace if this was configured when the MED-V workspace was created.

segment.source: Ftscompletion.exe is typically called through the Sysprep,inf file but can also be run through another method, such as a script.
segment.target: Ftscompletion.exe is typically called through the Sysprep,inf file but can also be run through another method, such as a script.

segment.source: However, Ftscompletion.exe must be the last action that is performed when the workstation is configured.
segment.target: However, Ftscompletion.exe must be the last action that is performed when the workstation is configured.

segment.source: For more information, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information, see Configuring a Windows Virtual PC Image for MED-V.

segment.source: After the MED-V workspace is restarted by Ftscompletion.exe, the end user is logged on.
segment.target: After the MED-V workspace is restarted by Ftscompletion.exe, the end user is logged on.

segment.source: If they did not save their password during first time setup, they are prompted for it again.
segment.target: If they did not save their password during first time setup, they are prompted for it again.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace is then started and configured for the user.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace is then started and configured for the user.

segment.source: Configuration includes applying Group Policy.
segment.target: Configuration includes applying Group Policy.

segment.source: We recommend that you apply only those policies that make sense in an application compatibility environment for Windows XP.
segment.target: We recommend that you apply only those policies that make sense in an application compatibility environment for Windows XP.

segment.source: For example, desktop personalization policies do not typically need to be applied and should be disabled.
segment.target: For example, desktop personalization policies do not typically need to be applied and should be disabled.

segment.source: For more information about how to allow only local profiles, see Group Policy Settings for Roaming User Profiles (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205072).
segment.target: For more information about how to allow only local profiles, see Group Policy Settings for Roaming User Profiles (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=205072).

segment.source: After first time setup is complete, the end user is notified that the published applications are ready.
segment.target: After first time setup is complete, the end user is notified that the published applications are ready.

segment.source: They are then able to access the applications installed in the MED-V workspace from their Start menu.
segment.target: They are then able to access the applications installed in the MED-V workspace from their Start menu.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Prepare the Deployment Environment for MED-V
segment.target: Prepare the Deployment Environment for MED-V

segment.target: Deployment of MED-V
